intro: Acridocarpus hemicyclopterus, commonly known as the Malabar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a distinctive feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
